How to Use Plant Health Assist
Welcome to Plant Health Assist! This app helps you identify plant diseases by analyzing photos of affected plants. To begin, simply tap the \"Scan Plant\" button on the home screen.

For best results:

• Ensure good lighting
• Focus on the affected area
• Keep the camera steady
• Take photos from 20-30cm away
• Include both healthy and affected parts if possible

All your previous scans are saved locally on your device. You can access them anytime from the History screen. Each entry shows the plant photo, detected disease, and scan date. Tap any entry to view full details.

Your plant appears to be healthy! Continue with regular care practices including appropriate watering, sunlight, and nutrition.

Blight infection detected. Recommendations:

• Remove and destroy infected plant parts
• Ensure good air circulation
• Apply appropriate fungicide
• Water at soil level to avoid wetting leaves
• Rotate crops in future plantings

Rust disease detected. Recommendations:

• Remove and destroy infected leaves
• Apply fungicides specifically labeled for rust
• Improve air circulation around plants
• Avoid overhead watering
• Practice crop rotation

Powdery mildew detected. Recommendations:

• Improve air circulation
• Apply fungicide treatments
• Remove severely infected leaves
• Water in the morning so leaves can dry
• Use resistant varieties in future plantings

Viral infection detected. Recommendations:

• Unfortunately, there is no cure for viral plant diseases
• Remove and destroy infected plants
• Control insects that may spread the virus
• Disinfect gardening tools
• Plant resistant varieties in the future

Bacterial infection detected. Recommendations:

• Remove and destroy infected plant parts
• Apply copper-based bactericides
• Improve air circulation
• Avoid overhead watering
• Practice good garden sanitation

General recommendations for plant health:

• Remove affected plant parts
• Improve air circulation
• Avoid overhead watering
• Consider appropriate fungicide or pesticide treatment
• Practice crop rotation and good sanitation
Reminders to check on your plant\'s health and treatment progress
